title: The Future of Plastic Pollution - The Oxford Scientist
body: The total number of marine species adversely affected by plastic pollution has risen six-fold from 250 in 1995 to 1450 in 2018 (2). Microplastics have been found in 114 aquatic species, more than half of which are consumed by humans (7). Research has yet to find plastics making their way from the gut of fish to their muscles, but through foods ...
